page.title: 17St James's Church
page.content: St. James's Church stands on the eastern edge of Thornton village. It was opened in 1872. The bell tower is about 150 feet or 50 metres high. The church is big enough to seat about 500 people. In the church are the bell and stone font from the old bell chapel. The altar is below the east facing window so that the sun shines through in the mornings. The remains of the old bell chapel stand across the road. It was here that the father of the famous Bronte children preached in the nineteenth century. Some Bronte relics can be found in St James's church today.
